Does anyone know the origin of &quot;Embracing No Form,&quot; the Druid move? It sounds so familiar to me, but I can&#39;t place it. I thought Ghost Dog at first, but didn&#39;t hear it in there, and then I thought maybe it came from a Yukio Mishima poem, but no dice there, either.
<div id='comment z123jnmyoxvxuxlv023ud1aplzjdepiq104'>

      <p><cite>2017-09-09 01:24:28 (edited: 2017-09-09 01:24:28)</cite></p>
        <p>+1 for Ghost Dog reference</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z123jnmyoxvxuxlv023ud1aplzjdepiq104'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/105493931245261821643_photo.jpg'> Dylan Knight</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-09-09 01:30:52 (edited: 2017-09-09 01:31:31)</cite></p>
        <p>I think he says something like &quot;Embrace no form&quot; or something similar in the Bruce Lee movie. I think it when he&#39;s doing the recovery montage. I&#39;m not really confident in that though. Even if, might not be the inspiration source</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z123jnmyoxvxuxlv023ud1aplzjdepiq104'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/104675236432730777219_photo.jpg'> John at Deep Six Delver</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-09-09 01:37:14 (edited: 2017-09-09 01:37:14)</cite></p>
        <p>&quot;Embracing no form&quot; and the name &quot;Wei&quot; are both allusions to the Tao Te Ching.</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z123jnmyoxvxuxlv023ud1aplzjdepiq104'>
